Vulnerabilities: Lack of proper encoding for non-ASCII characters in URL path forwarding
SecurityMeasures: Access restriction for /uberadmin directory based on IP

Steps.Description: Perform web application reconnaissance to identify vulnerabilities.

StepDetails.Hypothesis: The attacker aims to gather information about the web application to find any vulnerabilities that can be exploited.
StepDetails.Action: The attacker visits the provided link and explores the hyperlinks for different directories.
StepDetails.Result: The attacker discovers open directories (admin and uberadmin) and a restricted user directory.

Steps.Description: Exploit URL path forwarding vulnerability to access restricted directories.

StepDetails.Hypothesis: The attacker hypothesizes that the server is forwarding requests from /pleb{anything} to example.com{anything}.
StepDetails.Action: The attacker tests different variations of the /pleb directory, such as /pleb., /pleb~, and /pleb{anythingElse}.
StepDetails.Result: The attacker confirms that the server is forwarding requests to example.com{anything}.

Steps.Description: Set up a wildcard DNS listener to validate the forwarding behavior.

StepDetails.Hypothesis: The attacker suspects that the server is treating /pleb{anything} as a DNS request for example.com.
StepDetails.Action: The attacker sets up a wildcard DNS listener and sends a request to /pleb.mysub.dnsbin.zhack.ca.
StepDetails.Result: The attacker receives a DNS query for example.com, confirming the forwarding behavior.

Steps.Description: Exploit URL path forwarding to access localhost and download nginx.conf.

StepDetails.Hypothesis: The attacker aims to access the localhost and download the nginx.conf file.
StepDetails.Action: The attacker sends a request to /pleb.127.0.0.1.nip.io and checks if the user directory is accessible.
StepDetails.Result: The attacker successfully accesses the user directory and discovers the nginx.conf file.

Steps.Description: Exploit non-ASCII character encoding vulnerability to download nginx.conf.

StepDetails.Hypothesis: The attacker suspects that the server is not forwarding non-ASCII characters in the URL path.
StepDetails.Action: The attacker attempts to double URL encode non-ASCII characters to bypass the forwarding restriction.
StepDetails.Result: The attacker successfully downloads the nginx.conf file by double URL encoding non-ASCII characters.

Steps.Description: Discover X-Accel-Redirect header and bypass internal directive for /admin directory.

StepDetails.Hypothesis: The attacker aims to bypass the internal directive for the /admin directory to access its contents.
